description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Memory Systems Validation and Automation Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

As a Memory Systems Validation and Automation Engineer, you will develop fast, minimal infrastructure to support ASIC development flows, use careful code reviews to ensure bug free, consistent development, and develop for multiple generations of each design and for an expanding team.

You will develop and maintain prototyping platforms for our ASIC designs, create qualification and characterization tests for functional verification and validation of our systems, and be a key player in the bring-up, debug, and maintenance of our developing and deployed systems.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in silicon validation and automation.
  • 2 years of SoC/DRAM experience, including testing and debugging of hardware and software.
  • Programming experience in C++, Python or similar.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with Bench tools like oscilloscope, Logic Analyzers, Power Analyzers, etc. Understand DRAM cell architectures, DRAM memory organization and periphery design for low DRAM power.
  • Experience in silicon validation and automation with debugging hardware and software as well as Experience in system level memory (DRAM) validation as well as knowledge of memory test patterns
  • Proficient programming experience in C++, Python, or similar
  • Excellent with debugging hardware and software and Excellent communication skills and collaboration abilities
responsibilities:
• Work with design, product and SiVal engineers to ensure that DRAM systems meet Google’s product development and deployment schedules.
  • Develop DRAM validation, qualification, and debugging software tools and collaborate with DRAM engineers for DRAM Lab solutions.
  • Go beyond the industry norm and demonstrate creativity in problem solving, ability to think dynamically and outside of standard convention, and adapt quickly to new technical areas.
  • Support test development, bringup, and validation and qualification of DRAM subsystems, as well as plan and procure SoC/DRAM Lab hardware/software and tools.
title: Memory Systems Validation and Automation Engineer
